column4: hey guys, so rsync is returning a "No space left on device (28)" when the device im writing to is clearly not full... ideas?
is there a disk quota in place?
how do i find that out?
typing "quota" on the target machine should indicate something
here what i get "The program 'quota' is currently not installed."
how close is the filesystem to being full?
289gb used 627gb free
do you have write permission to the target directory?
yeah i used chown to get write permission
what are the current permissions of the target directory
im sorry i dont know what the command is to get the rxetc readout
try "ls -ld <directory>"
drwxr-xr-x 9 weekly weekly 4096 2010-04-16 08:15
looks fine. can you move data to that target with scp?
yes i can
what's the exact rsync line you use?
rsync -av /home/weekly/link_to_setux_gis-data/ /media/gis/ >> /home/weekly/Desktop/gis_backup_log.txt
is your /tmp directory full, by any chance?
does the "--inplace" switch help at all?
the /tmp has a ver small amount of data in it, ill man the --inplace and see if it will help
none of your partitions are running close to full? rsync makes a temporary copy of the data by default...
possably the swap partition gets full? where does rsync make the temp copy? i mean, last night i ran it and it got about 80% of the 300ish gigs, it just didnt complete
